FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_prev_prog_3.Description:
Acrylonitrile is produced by combining propylene, ammonia, and air in a fluidized catalyst bed reactor.  This is used as a raw material in the manufacture of nylon carpet fibers and acrylic fabrics at other Acsend locations. One of the byproducts of the reaction is the generation of hydrocyanic acid, which is transferred to central storage and is available for other on-site users.  While the HCN Central Storage is not physically located in the unit's battery limits, the quantity of HCN stored in the vessels are reported within this process.

Toxics alternate release scenarios for this site are generated from within these processes.  Alternate release scenarios for AN 2/3 include:

1.  An HCN release resulting from a pipe leak on the HCN Storage Circulation Loop
2.  An AN release resulting from a break off of a 2" nozzle from vessel 30S2
3.  An ammonia release resulting from a leak in the transfer line from Distribution to the AN units 

The Flammable alternate release scenario for this site is also generate from within these processes.  The scenario results from when the level in the oil seal pot on compressors drops too low, allowing for the release of propylene to the unit and releasing the system's propylene contents to the unit.

We take a systematic, proactive approach to preventing accidental releases of hazardous chemicals.  Our management systems address each of the key features of successful prevention programs including:    1. Process safety information;  2. Process hazard analysis; 2. Operating procedures; 3. Training; 4. Mechanical integrity Program; 5. Management of Change process; 6. Pre-startup review; 7. Compliance audits; 8. Incident investigation; 9. Employee participation; 10. Hot work permits, and; 11. Contractors.

The Distribution Unit handles the bulk storage and transportation of raw materials, intermediates and products needed and generated at the site.

Both the Toxic and Flammable Worst Case Scenarios are generated from within the Distribution Unit, and they are:

Toxic:  Catastrophic failure of T311-3, an above ground Acrylonitrile storage tank, resulting in the release of entire contents to a diked area in a 10 minute period.

Flammable:  Catastrophic failure of one of the Propylene bullets (T161-6/7/8), which have common connection, and can result in the loss of the complete contents of all three vessels.

We take a systematic, proactive approach to preventing accidental releases of hazardous chemicals.  Our management systems address each of the key features of successful prevention programs including:    1. Process safety information;  2. Process hazard analysis; 2. Operating procedures; 3. Training; 4. Mechanical integrity Program; 5. Management of Change process; 6. Pre-startup review; 7. Compliance audits; 8. Incident investigation; 9. Employee participation; 10. Hot work permits, and; 11. Contractors.

The LAB unit, a guest company unit, generates linear alkyl benzene, a raw material in the manufacture of detergents. The only RMP regulated chemical that this unit uses is hydrogen fluoride.  There is no anhydrous HF storage on site; an alternate release scenario would be for a vessel leak and the release of aqueous hydrofluoric acid from vessel 51S2 into a diked area.

We take a systematic, proactive approach to preventing accidental releases of hazardous chemicals.  Our management systems address each of the key features of successful prevention programs including:    1. Process safety information;  2. Process hazard analysis; 2. Operating procedures; 3. Training; 4. Mechanical integrity Program; 5. Management of Change process; 6. Pre-startup review; 7. Compliance audits; 8. Incident investigation; 9. Employee participation; 10. Hot work permits, and; 11. Contractors.

The MHBA Unit is a guest company unit whose finished products are animal feed supplements.

We take a systematic, proactive approach to preventing accidental releases of hazardous chemicals. Hot work permits, and; 11. Contractors.

Nitrilo-Trisodium Acetate (NTA) is a chelating agent used as a water softening detergent builder, increasing a detergent's cleaning ability.

An alternate release scenario associated with this process involves a release from a 1/5-inch hole in the liquid level of a sulfur dioxide cylinder, with approximately 24 inches of liquid column above the hole.

The DSIDA Unit is a guest company unit and produces Imino-Diacetic-Acid (IDA), which is one of the chemical building blocks in the production of herbicides.

The Formalin unit manufactures a chemical intermediate which is used within the plant, but is also sold to outside customers.  An alternate release scenario was identified for the unit and involves the release of Formalin (which is a solution of Formaldehyde in concentrations greater than 37%) during transfer from the largest storage tank, T88S8.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Ascend Performance Materials LLC - Chocolate Bayou - Alvin, TX                                                          12/17/2010

Ascend Performance Materials LLC (APM) has officially adopted the following six commitments, expressing our intention to operate responsibly.  
1.  We will ensure that our operations and distribution systems are safe for employees, visitors, site contractors, communities and the environment.
2.  We will make products that are safe when used responsibly.
3.  We will keep our operations open to our communities and foster open communications with all of our stakeholders.
4.  We will continuously improve our raw material and energy utilization efficiencies, to reduce our impact on the environment and improve the sustainability of our businesses.
5.  We will encourage active participation in and positive contributions to safety, health and environmental stewardship by our employees.
6.  We will search worldwide for new technologies that bring environmental, safety and health value to all of our stakeholders.

By acting on these commitments, we expect to match the best practices of our peer companies and to adhere to the Responsible Care guidelines developed by the American Chemical Council.  We are an OSHA Voluntary Protection Plan (VPP) Star Site and ISO 14001 certified.

There are five APM units at Chocolate Bayou that are covered under EPA's Risk Management Plan (RMP).

There are three "Guest Company" Units at Chocolate Bayou; APM has arrangements to manage and operate units owned by three other companies.  The owning companies secure raw materials and arrange product shipping.  All three have long-term leases for the land occupied by the units.  All handle chemicals covered by RMP. 
 
1.0 Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
APM Chocolate Bayou has a long and proud history of maintaining our processes in a safe and responsible manner.  We use a combination of accidental release prevention programs and emergency r

esponse planning programs to protect our employees, the environment, and the community.  This document provides a brief overview of the comprehensive risk management activities that we have designed and implemented.

2.0 Stationary Source and Regulated Substances
Our facility produces a variety of chemicals.  APM operates and manages the facility, while the 3 guest companies own unit assets operated and managed by APM personnel.  There are a total of eight processes that handle chemicals covered by RMP.  

3.0 Key Offsite Consequence Analysis Scenarios
APM used RMP*Comp to model potential consequences as required in the RMP rule.  The specifics of the Worst and Alternative cases are provided in the update.  

4.0 General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps
We take a systematic, proactive approach to preventing accidental releases of hazardous chemicals.  Our management systems address all elements of the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) regulations.  Chemical specific monitoring devices, response protocols, material of construction, process interlocks, and operator training combine to mitigate the inherent risks. 

5.0  Five-year Accident History
We keep records for all significant accidental chemical releases that occur at our facility.   In the past five years we have had no incident involving materials covered under EPA's RMP rule that meet the reporting requirements set forth in the program.  

6.0 Emergency Response Program
We maintain an integrated contingency plan (ICP) that consolidates all of the various federal, State of Texas, and local regulatory requirements for emergency response planning.  It covers emergency planning, training, and coordinating with the community emergency response plan.  

7.0 Ongoing Changes for Continuous Improvement to Safety
The following is a list of ongoing improvements that we are implementing at the facility to help prevent and/or better respond to accidental chemical releases:
a.

Maintain a capital and maintenance program to enhance reliability of operating units, therefore reducing upset conditions.
b.    Maintain OSHA Star Status
c.    Maintain ISO 14000 Status

8.0 Certification
APM Chocolate Bayou has no Program 1 or 2 processes.  To the best of the undersigned's knowledge, information, and belief formed after reasonable inquiry, the information submitted is true, accurate, and complete.
                                                                                           
_________________________________________________     December 17, 2010
Paul Cartlidge
Ascend Performance Materials LLC Chocolate Bayou Plant Manager
